title: Ticket #2925: DAGMan will fail if node job user logs are rotated
description:
The actual event reading code can now handle log file rotation; but DAGMan decided to call the event reading code based on the log file(s) getting bigger. That obviously could be broken by log file rotation...

I'm not sure that we couldn't just go ahead and call the ReadMultipleUserLogs::readEvent() method without first checking the log file size. (I'm not sure -- we need to check whether that's significantly less efficient before we go with it.)

At any rate, we should change things around such that log file rotation doesn't goof things up; and add a test for it!

Oh, yeah -- this has probably been broken since forever on the DAGMan end, but it's not until relatively recently that we had the capability to rotate job user logs, I think.
